page.title: 16ENOCH POWELL
page.content: {Enoch Powell}was born in 1912.He received his education at{King Edwards {School}in Birmingham,and later at {Trinity College,Cambridge.}He became Greek Professor at the University of Sydney in New South Wales in 1937,but served in the army in the Second World War. He entered{Parliament}and became {Parliamentary Secretary}to the Minister of Local government in 1955, {Financial Secretary to the Treasury}in 1957 and Minister of Health in 1960. He became famous due to his views on {immigration and his opposition to {Britain joining the Common Market. Having refused to stand as a Conservative in the 1974 elections, he was adopted as an United Ulster Unionist Council Candidate in 1974 and was re-elected to Parliament for this party in both 1979 and 1983.
